data.title: Treated like family!
data.text: My daughter in law had a baby shower for her sister in law here at Acre. They were Awesome!! The service was outstanding and the food was delicious. All the guys hung out at the bar eating and watching college football. We were treated like family and are thankful to the Staff for their hospitality. We will be back.

data.title: Dinner with my daughter
data.text: I was able to visit my daughter and attend her sorority initiation.  We enjoyed dinner at Acre - it was my first time.  Wow - what incredible food. They grow many of their own items right there on the property.  Our server was such a nice, sweet and attentive young lady.  The food was delicious.  We shared many small plates and grazed our way through dinner.  They have a nice wine list.  We sat on glassed-in patio.  And the table behind us was chilly due to the weather and the restaurant offered flannel blankets to use.  I've never seen anything like that - how adorable!  I can't wait to go back to dinner at this wonderful restaurant.

data.title: I'll Put Acre Up Against Any Restaurant In My Home Town
data.text:
Award winning chef, extensive wine list and a unique menu makes this place as good as it gets for the price. The bone in short rib entree was awesome as was the duck. We are French burgundy drinkers and there were several to choose from (very unusual at this price point). There's a lively bar with some hard to find liquors like Pappy Van winkle 15. The servers were very attentive and went out of there way to help. 

Hint: it can get pretty loud, so ask for a booth. And make game day reservations 30-45 days ahead.  'Nuff said.

data.title: delightful-healthful food in Auburn
data.text: We had a dinner for four after a big football game.  The service was flawless despite a big crowd.  The food was delightfully innovative and fresh as well as beautifully presented.  The group shared the ample charcuterie board with world-class bresola and salami.  It was plenty for our hungry group as a starter.  The seafood was super fresh and cooked with a lovely crisp crust but moist center.  The snapper with "creamed popped corn" sauce was delicious - I don't know how else to describe it but it was certainly tastier than it sounded.  Kudos too to the drink mixologists.

data.title: Great food, mediocre service
data.text: No doubt the food was some of the best we've had anywhere.  But the host greeting upon entering the restaurant was far below what a paying customer should receive.  Very cold and aloof.   If I were alone, I would have walked out because clearly they did not need my patronage.  Once seated, it took 10 minutes for our server to arrive and her service never improved.  She had no personality and was just looking to get her shift over.  I overheard another server and the service he was providing should have earned him a raise (our waiter's pay check).  The food was excellent was it arrived.  It took 25 minutes after we ordered.  So if you get better treatment, you will enjoy your visit.  I won't give them another dime.

data.title: Great place to eat!
data.text: This was our first visit and it started out not very well but ended up being a nice experience.  Upon entering the restaurant a nice young lady greeted us and was about to seat us when an older hostess came and whispered something almost audible but not quite to the younger hostess.  The young hostess seemed puzzled but the older hostess had her change our table to one in the back by the kitchen and two tables with young children.  This was a special getaway for my husband and I and I almost said something about the treatment we received but I did not want to ruin it for my husband.  The customer should not be made to feel irrelevant or inferior.  Besides that bad experience, we enjoyed our meal, especially the Dixie Picnic Platter! Our server was excellent!

data.title: Acre For Lunch
data.text: Having a Business lunch? Acre is the place to take some of your customers. The atmosphere is wonderful and the food is great. The wait staff were very attentive.

data.title: Unbeatable
data.text: The fried green tomatoes are the best I've ever tasted. Our waiter was attentive but not overbearing, seemed to anticipate our needs. They have complimentary baker parking too.

data.title: Overpriced & overrated
data.text: Have eaten both lunch and a few dinners. Service has been mediocre. Had a dinner order sent to the wrong table and one meal half cooked. We had a party of four at a recent visit. The meals took 28 min. from order to receive and the meal that went to the wrong table took another 18 minutes to redo and get to our table!

data.title: Good food and good atmosphere
data.text: We had five people and went to Acre for a nice dinner.  We were not disappointed, everything from the appetizers to the deserts was good.

data.title: Vegetarian friendly dining in the South
data.text: I was so please to enjoy the Lee County sampler of regional vegetarian fair farm to table in a charming setting. The server helped me to find a great choice.

data.title: Wonderful food
data.text: For my husband's birthday we chose Acre.  We brought his parents and our children. The food was delicious and prepared perfectly. The service was impeccable and the wine perfect. Definitely 5 stars!

data.title: Great atmosphere, delicious food and local craft beers.
data.text: We came for a late lunch after a college tour, and we enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere, and we didn't feel rushed by our server at all.  We tried a few of their local beers and enjoyed the pimento cheese dip and fried green tomatoes.  The Gilbert grape chicken salad, the catfish tacos and the this should fix it brisket were delicious and large portions.  Thank you for a lovely meal.

data.title: worthy of a visit
data.text: Celebrated my birthday with my sister over brunch.  She could not have made a better restaurant selection. We were served the daily special which included a southern favorite of salmon croquettes and fresh local vegetables plus an order of chicken and waffles. Both dishes were delicious and we are looking forward to returning.

data.title: We'll be back!
data.text:
Had a delicious meal with friends and family this past weekend. Decor is eclectic and tasteful. Think rustic and chic. Service was helpful yet not intrusive. We had a party of 9 and we're delighted to get in bc we arrived early (5:45pm) on a. Rey busy Friday night. No reservations on the weekend but we did early and thankfully they also offer valet service. 
We ordered pork rinds and got cheese fig dates...yum! And several different dinner options. Mine was pork chop with corn salsa. Delish!
We all enjoyed our visit and will be back!

data.title: Date night.
data.text:
This place is great for a couples night out for dinner or with friends has a good menu to choose from.
The prices are a bit higher than your average restaurant but then it's not your average restaurant.

data.title: Salmon Lunch
data.text: This place was awesome! Fresh grown vegetables from their garden. Beautifully eclectic southern menu. The blackened Salmon was delicious. Good service and reasonable prices make Acre a restaurant I look forward to visiting again soon.

data.title: Great food
data.text: My wife got reservations for Acre on for my birthday . I heard the place was kind of expensive and fancy so we had been shying away from the there but we decided to splurge. When we got there they had complimentary valley parking. The hostess was very nice and had us seated quickly . Our server was also very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and explained how Acre is a farm to table restaraunt. He also explained that Acre is on the top 100 restaraunts for wine selection which did not entirely surprise me because I seen a wall of wine bottles when we entered the place. They also have a nice selection of craft beer . It just so happened we were there on burger night which was a Tuesday. We both ordered a burger mine was called the Full Acre it was a half pound burger with a fried egg, bacon, onion rings, and cheddar cheese served with fries. The burger was cooked perfectly and was one of the best I have ever ate. I was pleasantly surprised, although the place is kind of fancy it's not over the top and the quality, freshness, and amount of food we received was well worth the price. I will defiantly go back!

data.title: Incredible brunch
data.text: Some of the best chicken and waffles EVER. Certainly one of the best places to eat in Auburn. They also have a very extensive wine/liquor list available to accompany a gourmet dinner.

data.title: A victim of their own success
data.text: We have been to Acre nearly every Friday night before football games and also other weekends for several years. This year before the first game,  I  called 5 times to speak to reservations, the manager, the owner's wife and the owner and have received no return calls. Nice way to treat a loyal customer. It is a shame I have to post this on Tripadvisor. They get so much business on football weekends they have forgotten about loyalty and good service. Good luck getting a reservation at this restaurant. There are other options in Auburn who appreciate your business.
